title.value: Quantitative electrophysiological assessments as predictive markers of lower limb motor recovery after spinal cord injury: a pilot study with an adaptive trial design
title.justification: The title is explicitly mentioned at the beginning of the paper, providing a clear indication of the study's focus.
title.quote: Quantitative electrophysiological assessments as predictive markers of lower limb motor recovery after spinal cord injury: a pilot study with an adaptive trial design

extractions.description: This paper investigates the feasibility of using quantitative electrophysiological assessments combined with MRI to predict lower limb motor recovery in patients with spinal cord injury. It proposes an adaptive trial design to explore the integration of these assessments into clinical rehabilitation settings.

type.justification: The study involves observational and experimental methods to gather data on the feasibility of electrophysiological assessments in predicting motor recovery, indicating empirical research.

name.justification: The paper focuses on rehabilitation methods and neuroscience applications related to spinal cord injury recovery.
The study's focus on electrophysiological assessments and their application in a clinical setting aligns with Clinical Neurophysiology.
